column4: guys guys help me out in this small problem I installed windows after ubuntu, my grub is lost, I installed it but its not coming at the startup
did this wiki, https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows, helps you at all??
come on, did this wiki, https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows, helps you at all??
ok. misspell?
misspell as in ?
in menu.lst file and what did the error said?
i can only get into the system through LIVE cd, you want me to do that ?
oh yeah. that is THE way to fix it. :)
I did follow the wiki and thats all what I'm saying the grub does not load at startup
what's an error message for grub?
no error message, windows just loads up
ah. ok. grub is not installed then.
what should I do ?

i never done this specific part before, but i have fixed my grub 3x when grub spew out err message. there is section called "Using the Desktop/LiveCD and Overwriting the Windows bootloader" where you need to re-install grub (since it boots straight to Win32)
i'm running the live cd and apparently grub is installed but it won't appear when I reboot & windows will load automatically, you want me to check any files or something ?
hmm. is there any timeout? it might be why?
is there timeout in menu.lst?
I just restarted the PC to check if grub appears this time, you replied so late
no grub, what you want me to do now, load the LIVE CD and see the contents of this file menu.lst ? where is this file located ?
yes. i do hope that is the problem. (crossed fingers)
should I install grub again now & then see the contens of this file or just see it right away after the live cd loads ?
just check the content of the file (as you said it is installed)
did u mount the root to see if grub file are intacted?
